intro: Thesium strictum, commonly known as the narrowleaf thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, narrow leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in late summer to early autumn. Thesium strictum is native to parts of Australia and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is a hardy plant that thrives in well-drained environments and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
